event.title: 1838 John Baker and several others left

data.event: In 1838 John Baker and several others left Sydney to seek land and setup stations on the Northern Tablelands.
By 1844 the property had been sold several times before Major Archibald Clunes Innes took it over that year.
By 1844 the property had been sold several times before Major Archibald Clunes Innes took it over that year.
At one stage Innes was one of the wealthiest men in the Colony, but suffered heavily during the 1840s depression and was declared bankrupt in 1852.

event.title: built the ‘Golden Fleece’ Hotel at Dundee in 1847

data.event: Major Innes built the ‘Golden Fleece’ Hotel at Dundee in 1847, to become one of the first three hotels built in New England.
